byline.contributor: Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting from San Francisco, and Julie Hirschfeld Davis and David E. Sanger from Washington.
byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and SCOTT SHANE

abstract: Obama administration says hackers breached second computer system within Office of Personnel Management and may have gained access to information about friends, family members and others associated with federal employees; Pres Obama is contemplating sanctions against those responsible, and investigators say Chinese hackers seem to have acquired that personnel data.
lead_paragraph: Officials said that the second system contained files related to intelligence officials working for the F.B.I., defense contractors and other government agencies.

headline.main: White House Weighs Sanctions After Second Breach of a Computer System
headline.print_headline: White House Weighs Sanctions After Second Breach of a Computer System

snippet: Officials said that the second system contained files related to intelligence officials working for the F.B.I., defense contractors and other government agencies.
